intro: Malvastrum fryxellii, commonly known as the Fryxell's mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, rocky habitats. Its botanical features make it an attractive and hardy addition to native plant gardens.
